utilities

Class ControlClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.ControlClass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.servlet.ServletContextListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BenchtopDemoSM, BenchtopDemoSMV2, RTD_DemoExperiment, TestExperiment

    public class ControlClass
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.ServletContextListener, java.io.Serializable, ControlInterface
    Hard-Coded Control classes should extend HardCodedControlClass. Classes that extend HardCodedControlClass should override the following methods: \code public HCExampleExperiment(String expID) { super(expID); }
    Author:
    jdk85
    See Also:
    HCExampleExperiment, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ControlClass.RBNBControl
      This inner class is meant to provide the base functionality for classes that extend HardCodedControlClass Normally, an experiment will extend HCCC and have an inner class that extends HCCC.RBNBControl This way, the experiment specific code only has to override the run() and include the necessary control logic within that method where all the backend processes (connecting to RBNB, sending commands) are handled by this class

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void contextDestroyed(javax.servlet.ServletContextEvent event)
      Overrides the servlet contextDestroyed method to make sure that any threads are shut down properly.
      void contextInitialized(javax.servlet.ServletContextEvent event)
      This method is intended to override the servlet context when starting up but since the initialize() function gets called whenever the servlet boots up, this isn't used.
      protected ControlClass.RBNBControl createRBNBControl()
      This function logs the creation of an RBNBControl object and returns a new instance of RBNBControl.
      java.lang.String disconnect()
      Thread-safe method to disconnect from RBNB and interrupt the RBNBControlThread The method will wait up to 30 seconds for the thread to successfully die, after which it resets the associated thread objects and logs its progress as well as returning a string containing the result of the operation
      static java.lang.String getIP()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public java.lang.String initialize()
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        Should never be called, but will pass along a nullary ID to initialize(String expID) if for some reason an experiment is missing it's ID. This is used as a form of error handling
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface ControlInterface
        Returns:
        Result of initialization
        See Also:
        ControlInterface

      • initialize

        public java.lang.String initialize(java.lang.String expID,
                          java.lang.String expDesc,
                          java.lang.String sinkServerAddress,
                          java.lang.String sourceServerAddress)
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        This functions as the constructor but is explicitly called when experiments are reloaded by the SegaExperimentServlet. This function takes in the experiment ID and creates a log for the control as well as sets up variables that shouldn't change. After configuring and logging the setup, it starts the main thread for running the control.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface ControlInterface
        Parameters:
        expID - - The unique identifier for the experiment
        expDesc - - String blob describing the experiment
        sinkServerAddress - - The RBNB address for the data sink (where to look to fetch data)
        sourceServerAddress - - The RBNB address for the data source (where to send control commands to)
        Returns:
        Result of initialization
        See Also:
        ControlInterface

      • initParams

        public void initParams()
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        This method initializes the generic experiment parameter array. Every experiment should have at least these parameters in addition to any custom experiment parameters that are added in the experiment code. The experiment code will make a super(initParams()) call before adding it's own unique parameters
        Specified by:
        initParams in interface ControlInterface
        See Also:
        ControlInterface

      • startThread

        public java.lang.String startThread()
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        Creates a new thread that runs the control logic. The createRBNBControl() method should be overridden in any class that extends ControlClass. That way the appropriate instance of RBNBControl is created. This function then starts the thread and logs whether or it was successfully started.
        Specified by:
        startThread in interface ControlInterface
        Returns:
        String indicating success or failure of starting the thread
        See Also:
        ControlInterface

      • reconnect

        public java.lang.String reconnect()
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        Function used to interrupt the currently running thread and reconnect to RBNB. By interrupting the thread, the main loop in RBNB control should fall out. Joining the thread allows the program to wait to make sure it has actually ended the thread before continuing. If 30 seconds time out and the thread still hasn't ended, the program continues executing which may be problematic in the future, and there is probably a safer way to implement this
        Specified by:
        reconnect in interface ControlInterface
        Returns:
        String indicating success or failure of reconnect
        See Also:
        ControlInterface

      • createRBNBControl

        protected ControlClass.RBNBControl createRBNBControl()
        This function logs the creation of an RBNBControl object and returns a new instance of RBNBControl.
        Returns:
        A new instance of RBNBControl class

      • getLog

        public SegaLogger getLog()
        This method returns the log object for this particular instance of HardCodedControl. This log file is used by the RBNB control object so that it can write to the same location. When writing the RBNB control code, this method can be used to retrieve the log object to write error or status messages.
        Returns:

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        Getter for a message string that is unique to the experiment upload to indicate that it is the expected version of the control code. The message string is actually defined in the experiment object
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        Message string (e.g. "Last edit: 01/01/1970 12:00PM")

      • disconnect

        public java.lang.String disconnect()
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        Thread-safe method to disconnect from RBNB and interrupt the RBNBControlThread The method will wait up to 30 seconds for the thread to successfully die, after which it resets the associated thread objects and logs its progress as well as returning a string containing the result of the operation
        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface ControlInterface
        Returns:
        String indicating success or failure of disconnect
        See Also:
        ControlInterface

      • updateParameter

        public void updateParameter(java.lang.String idName,
                   java.lang.Object newVal)
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        This is setter function to change the value of an experiment parameter given that it exists. If it doesn't, an error is internally recorded as this method does not return anything.

      • getParameters

        public java.util.ArrayList<ExperimentParameterObject> getParameters()
        Description copied from interface: ControlInterface
        A helper method used to return the arraylist containing all of the experiment parameters. This is used by experiment child classes to append experiment specific parameters to the parent class experiment parameter array object
